attributes.comment:
Dear Sirs:
I would like to comment on the proposed changes to the fee structures which
would affect the I-600/I-600A petitions. These forms are used in international
adoptions. As you are probably already aware, adoption is a very expensive
process. As a prospective single adoptive parent, the burden of ever increasing
fees could prevent me from pursuing this dream. The length of time it takes
between submitting paperwork for an adoption and actually receiving information
on an available child is ever increasing, while the time that these documents are
valid is finite. In my opinion, it is unconscionable to request a 66% increase in
these fees, while most families in this process are already looking at having to
pay these fees TWICE due to the forms expiring before a child's referral is
received by the adoptive family. Most families, while they want a child more than
anything in the world, must struggle to pay the existing fees as it is. At the very
least, there should be some sort of compromise in this process. Perhaps
increase the fees by half of the proposed amount, while increasing the amount of
time that these forms and fingerprints are valid. Or go ahead with the proposed
increase, but significantly extend the amount of time that the forms and
fingerprints are valid so that the likelihood of having to pay them twice is
diminished.
Adoption is a very difficult and expensive process as it is. Please do not consider
raising these fees without helping families, in some other way (i.e. extending the
validity of the approvals), to pursue this option to build a family.
Thank you for your time.
Jami Andre'

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Jami L. Andre
